description:
Rickettsia bellii RML369-C is a species of bacteria belonging to the genus Rickettsia, which are obligate intracellular pathogens known to cause various tick-borne diseases. Rickettsia bellii RML369-C is a Gram-negative, pleomorphic, and coccobacillary bacterium that is typically found in association with arthropod hosts, particularly ticks.

This specific strain, RML369-C, was isolated from a tick of the genus Dermacentor collected in the United States. Rickettsia bellii is considered a member of the spotted fever group of Rickettsia, although it has some unique genomic and phenotypic characteristics that distinguish it from other members of this group.

Rickettsia bellii RML369-C is known to have a relatively wide host range, infecting various tick species and potentially other arthropods. While the pathogenicity of this particular strain is not well-established, the Rickettsia bellii species as a whole is not typically considered a significant human pathogen, although it may have some implications for veterinary or ecological health.

Further research is needed to fully understand the biology, epidemiology, and potential impacts of Rickettsia bellii RML369-C and other strains within this species.
